snippet: The vote on whether to arm and train Syrian rebels should be entirely separate from the spending bill to keep the government running.
abstract: Editorial decries Republican lawmakers for including aid to Syrian rebel groups in a short-term continuing spending resolution that will finance government only through December; holds measure will force lawmakers to choose between paying for the rebels and shutting down the government; argues aid vote should be held entirely separately so that voters can know where their representatives stand on issue.
lead_paragraph: The vote on whether to arm and train Syrian rebels should be entirely separate from the spending bill to keep the government running.

headline.main: Don’t Hide the Syrian Aid Vote
